Class Application

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • Application
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Application
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This class is where everything is called. IT keeps track of which classes to show and switches between panels to show.

    Modification

    May 27, 2017 Daniel made Application class use gameSlides.

    June 05, 2017 Arsh edited Application class to use playGame class and no gameSlides.

    Authors: Daniel Arakcheev, and Arsh Raza Date: June 05, 2017 Version: 2.0

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Application

        public Application()
        Class constructor sets up panes and adds it to the frames. Sets everything to not visible and loads the highscores. It then calls the splashscreen. For loop is used to add panels to the frame.

    • Method Detail

      • goToPane

        public void goToPane(int nextPaneIndex)
        This is used to switch panels. It sets the current panel to not visible and makes the next one visible.

        Variable Dictionary

        nextPane a referance to the next panel to be set visible.

      • loadHighscores

        public void loadHighscores()
        This loads the highscores from the highscores file and keeps it in the array.

        Variable dictionary

        name reads in a line for the name in highscores file.

        score reads in score in highscores file.

      • saveHighscores

        public void saveHighscores()
        This method saves the highscores to the file.

        Variable dictionary

        output Printwrite for writing to the file..

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
